poem:
"Lessons on May Mornings"

Small hands scribe
on lined paper, their hopes.
Pledges poured onto pages
in seas of untamed imagination.
Youths, tender in years,
yet mature in convictions.
Raised voices echo
in hallowed halls of power,
Their lessons, raw and innocent,
rooted in red brick school box.
No forward gaze ever so piercing,
speaks truer than these 10-year-old eyes,
Dare we to listen,
To the wisdom of their youth.
